issues.description: The solution's GET /persons endpoint requires an additional required query parameter named "limit" (PersonResource.getAllPersons has @RequestParam(value = "limit") int limit) while the problem statement and the client code never mention or send such a parameter. The problem statement describes GET /persons as returning all persons (no limit), and the client PersonController.getAllPersons builds a request with only sortField and sortingOrder. Because the server requires limit, client requests that do not include it will fail (Spring will treat the parameter as required), causing runtime errors and confusing students who follow the specification and template.

The problem statement describes the callback parameter for PersonController methods as Consumer<List<Note>> (referring to Note), but both the template and solution PersonController implementations use Consumer<List<Person>>. This mismatched identifier (Note vs Person) refers to the same conceptual entity (the persons list) and can mislead students about the required types/signatures when implementing the client-side controller methods.
issues.suggested_fix: Correct the problem statement to refer to Consumer<List<Person>> (instead of Consumer<List<Note>>) for the PersonController methods. For example, replace the line "Each method takes a `Consumer<List<Note>>` parameter" with "Each method takes a `Consumer<List<Person>>` parameter" so the description matches the template and solution signatures and avoids type confusion.
